meanings.definition: A type of traditional Newfoundland dish made with fried dough
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed eating toutons for breakfast this morning.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother makes the best toutons in town.
meanings.sent3: The toutons were so delicious that I couldn't stop eating them.
meanings.sent4: The smell of freshly cooked toutons filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The golden-brown toutons were a delightful treat.

meanings.sent1: The chef would always toutons his special recipe to the customers.
meanings.sent2: She would often toutons her favorite book to her friends.
meanings.sent3: He would toutons his own achievements at every opportunity.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to toutons their new product through social media.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would always toutons the importance of studying hard.

meanings.definition: A person who solicits business or employment aggressively
meanings.sent1: The toutons outside the store were trying to sell us a new phone plan.
meanings.sent2: The persistent toutons at the job fair handed out flyers to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The toutons at the market were eager to offer their services to passersby.
meanings.sent4: The ambitious toutons were always looking for new clients.
meanings.sent5: The enthusiastic toutons never gave up on trying to make a sale.
